title: Seems abandoned
text: I really like this app but the last update was almost two years ago. There are some missing features that would be really helpful but it seems like the developers are no longer working on changing the functionality anymore. Other apps continue to add and improve their features.

title: Great app overall
text: Really appreciating Freedom so far. I love how versatile and customized the blocklists can be. The only thing I‚Äôve run into so far that I wish was different is that when you go in to edit a blocklist, you can‚Äôt just see what apps are on the list. It shows how many apps are blocked, but not which ones, so you end up having to search through all the categories, or just remember which ones you blocked (in order to find and unblock them if needed). A little annoying, but overall, would recommend the app to anyone struggling with device use/abuse.

title: It does not work
text: It does not work.

title: Poor value
text: The cost for this basic functionality is absurd

title: Finally.
text: An app that actually works across devices and has ways to lock yourself out from turning it off. Seriously thank you to whoever made this. Humanity needs this.

title: Helped me break my digital addiction
text:
For months I had felt the keen need to go touch grass, figuratively speaking. The iphone screen time function was too easy for me to bypass, and even if I did abide by it, I‚Äôd get on my computer to scratch that itch for a dopamine hit.

That‚Äôs where Freedom helps. It doesn‚Äôt just block one app, it blocks all the apps you don‚Äôt want to be distracted by on all of your devices if you need to. I was finding that if I stopped using instagram, for example, I would just replace it with something else, like Reddit. Now, with the help of Freedom, I reach for my phone less, my screen time is down, I often don‚Äôt even notice that I don‚Äôt have access to certain apps because in general I‚Äôm using the less. And finally, I built up the courage to deactivate Instagram because Freedom helped me to wean myself off.

I highly recommend this simple yet effective tool if you‚Äôre ready to live life off of your devices.

title: Satisfied customer
text: Much easier to use and more effective than Apple tools to restrict digital distractions. My compulsive-scrolling-addled brain is healing üå∫

title: Beware: doesn‚Äôt sync without WiFi
text: This is a great app, but users should be aware that if you don‚Äôt have an active internet connection on your computer (not your phone), then your Freedom session will not end at the scheduled time. This means that, in theory, you could potentially be locked out of your computer for days after a session was supposed to end if you didn‚Äôt have internet.

title: More productive lately
text: I‚Äôve been using for the past few weeks and I‚Äôm noticing my productivity is up and I‚Äôm more involved in things that should matter to be personally. Glad I found this tool for help. Very easy to use. Will add that sometimes it takes a couple minutes to kick on for my reoccurring blocks.

title: Best app
text: Blocks my distractions and brain rot whenever I‚Äôm too weak to walk away from the screen. Freedom is priceless folks

title: The most efficient app to curb doom scrolling
text: I‚Äôve tried other apps that are easily bypassed or deleted altogether, this app really allowed the maximum amount of screen time control without feeling like my phone would self destruct lol. I‚Äôve taken my doom scrolling down from literally like 8hrs a day to 1 day a week allowance, and maybe just an hour or two total for that entire day. I‚Äôve passed it along to a few friends as well who have been enjoying it. If you need help detoxing from information overload, this app is exactly what you need.

title: Thanks
text: This product is for people who want to see the supernatural power of self control and dedication

title: The Only Thing That Worked!!
text: I love it. Tried the free trial for 3 days and was like ‚ÄúPLEASE TAKE MY MONEY!‚Äù Nothing else worked-I just would override all the other functions I‚Äôd put in place to keep me off social media, and I love that I can also add other apps that keep me from doing actual things I enjoy instead of wasting 4 hours/day on my stupid phone.

title: Facebook
text: Why is your app contacting Facebook? Even in the background. Can you clarify?

title: Charged Anyway
text: Signed up for the free trial. Canceled before the free trial end date and was still charged for a year. I never even used the app as it was too complicated. Don‚Äôt fall for it.

title: Good app
text: It sometimes feels silly to need it. But it helps me keep social media from taking up too much time in my life with out needing to cut it off completely. You enjoy things more if engaging with them feels like a choice.

title: Best of the bunch
text: I‚Äôve tried a lot of solutions (dumb phone, minimal home screens, etc.), but nothing has worked like Freedom.

title: Not great
text: This app just doesn‚Äôt work well on my phone. Apps are not blocked. It seems to have something to do with background refresh. But, similar apps like Opal work perfectly. This app also lacks features like taking a 5m break.

title: App doesn‚Äôt work all the time
text: I love the idea of this app however, it doesn‚Äôt always work. Right now my social media apps are suppose to be block but they are available. Defeats the purpose of the app if it‚Äôs not reliable.

title: Absolutely useless

title: This is what I needed
text: Been using freedom for a long time now and it‚Äôs an app I cannot work without. Helps a lot with making me aware of how I spend my time online and how I really want to. Good for organizing your online and offline time.

title: Utter Garbage
text: Don‚Äôt pay for lifetime. Works once and then it‚Äôs impossible to login using any browser. does not work with Windows anymore. pointless and I can‚Äôt get a refund. like I said utter garbage. title: Yes it works
text: I‚Äôm actually free again! With every penny. This thing is a MUST in this day and age

title: Game changer
text: Love this. Really does put the freedom back in the hands of the user.

title: Works perfectly for apps not as good for websites
text: This is a life saver in so many ways. It isn‚Äôt easy to bypass which is the problem I‚Äôve had with every other app like this. If I had willpower to not exploit a loophole, I wouldn‚Äôt need this. But that‚Äôs also where it has problems, specifically for website blocking. It ONLY works on safari reliably, so anyone who has more than one browser on their phone effectively can‚Äôt use website blocking. For me that‚Äôs a big issue. For others it may not be an issue at all. I hope someday they support at least chrome.

title: Very helpful
text: Excellent productivity tool

title: Very helpful
text: Freedom is really helping me stop compulsively checking social media, and sometimes I even block the news if I‚Äôm just checking it to waste time! I like that the sessions can be ended because occasionally I block sites that I then need to check for actual work/reference reasons. It would be nice if sessions could be paused for a very short time (like 5-15 minutes?) and then turn back on to facilitate that.

title: Doesn‚Äôt always work
text: I paid for the year membership and although I have a daily schedule set up it doesn‚Äôt always work. If I click open the freedom app, then the block goes into effect. Also there is no way to just toggle off a block schedule when you are on vacation. You have to delete the schedule then remake it. Seems like the most basic functionality is missing. Would not recommend

title: New update, new upcharge
text: They now charge you more money ($39/year) if you need sessions longer than 2 hours. I loved this app, but it sold out  to be just like the rest of the blocking apps. I‚Äôll save myself the money and go back to putting my phone in another room to cut distractions.

text: Would help, if not for the fact you have to pay like $35 a month
